Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory57.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Black Knight moves to C6. White Pawn advances one square to C2.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Bishop, C8 to G4.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'Your intention to attack is obvious.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'You used to be less aggressive.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'Those sharp edges of yours will make you a target. All you did was expose this area for me to attack.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'John', 3: "Haven't I taught you to lay low and wait for the right opportunity to strike?", 4: '1'}
{3: "The White Queen moves to B3 with John's command, her threat plain as day."}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Unless... I am equipped to handle what happens next.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I, too, am capable of noticing the possible traps.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Chrome signals the Black Queen to move to D7, protecting the Pawn on F7.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "You might think I've shown my weaknesses, but my position might not be as penetrable as you thought.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory121.png'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: "Where's Asimov? Why isn't he here? Didn't we invite him specifically?"}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: "I heard he's working on something about a specialized frame. Probably too busy for this."}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: 'When was the last time you saw him at a place like this anyway?'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: 'Touche.'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: 'But the Science Council is paying a lot of attention to his little project. It could turn out to be something important.'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: "If it were up to Nikola, he would've invented all kinds of terrifying weapons."}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: "If we don't keep him in check..."}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: 'Sure, better weapons mean a better chance to reclaim Earth. But to "them," something uncontrollable is hardly worth the trouble.'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: 'I heard some councilmen proposed a bill to increase our hold on the Constructs, but President Hassen rejected it for "humanitarian grounds."'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: '"Humanitarian grounds"... Honestly, do they still count as humans?'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: 'Wasn\'t the bill proposed because of that "incident"? The way that Construct lost control...'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: 'I heard some civilians were hurt because of that...'}
{3: "The chatter from the guest not far from him has caught Chrome's attention. He looks at them, his head tilted."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chrome', 3: '(A Construct lost control?)', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "(I didn't hear anything about that when I was in the base... No Construct has been punished for assaults either.)", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "(It's a severe problem if a human is attacked by a Construct.)", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: '...Could someone be spreading this "rumor" intentionally?', 4: '1'}
{3: "At this stage, exploiting a Construct to push for one's agenda is a desperate last resort. Anyone in a position of power would be foolish to do something this self-sabotaging."}

{3: 'On the other hand, Chrome understands Constructs well enough to know that deviating M.I.N.D.s in regular military Constructs is nigh impossible in a place like Babylonia without external stimuli.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Something is afoot...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Thinking that he needs more information, Chrome proceeds to find John on the other end of the ballroom.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "Mr. Smith, there's something about...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Servant', 3: 'Mr. John Smith?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Servant', 3: 'Councilman Tram wishes to talk to you about the project regarding restarting the Central Purification Filter in City 089.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'John turns and looks at Chrome.'}
{2: 'John', 3: 'If you want information, you need to look for it yourself.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'John follows the servant away and leaves Chrome after his parting words.'}
{3: 'As John walks away, something that Chrome has been ignoring becomes blatantly clear.'}
{3: 'Even when the humans on Babylonia know little to nothing about the process of becoming a Construct, it is impossible that no one knows about his transformation due to who his father is.'}
{3: 'After all, there is nothing better to gossip about than the rich and powerful "screwing up."'}
{3: 'Shifting his back to the room, Chrome can feel gazes upon gazes fixated on him, but they all dart away the moment he turns to look.'}
{3: 'He adjusts his audio module and listens in on the chatter of the crowds.'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: "(Look, isn't that...)"}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: '(Why is there a Construct here?)'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: "(Shush! Didn't you hear what Smith just said? It's still his seat, so keep your voice down.)"}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: "(But why dress like a human when he's already a Construct...)"}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: '(Who can tell what the high and mighty thinks?)'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: '(Anyway, better stay away from him.)'}
{2: 'Chatter', 3: '(Right, lest he loses it like that Construct earlier...)'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Humans on Babylonia rarely come into contact with Constructs... so where do their impressions of Constructs come from?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I ought to investigate.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Chrome straightens his collar and heads toward the talking guests.'}
{3: 'With a polite smile, he salutes the embarrassed-looking crowd.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'About what you just said, would you mind telling me more about it?', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory16.jpg'}
{3: 'Classified Laboratory B3, Babylonia.'}
{3: 'Footsteps approach from the empty, expansive hall outside. With a light ring of acknowledgment from the retinal scanner, the heavy doors to the laboratory slide open.'}
{3: 'The lights from the corridor outside illuminate the dark room. A young researcher is sitting between an array of glowing monitors, and he squints toward the door.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Nikola', 3: "What's the result?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Based on the previous test, Lucia has indeed retrieved all her memories. Her M.I.N.D. has been stable so far with no sign of deviation.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'And her frame?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "She doesn't seem to have any problem using the Plume frame either.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The instability we saw before has greatly improved as well. As of now, the Plume frame is more or less fully realized, functioning the way I designed it to be.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'In that case, we can finally move on to the next stage of the specialized frame project.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Is there a problem?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "The draft of the next specialized frame is just about complete with the data I've got from Plume.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'There are simply not enough samples and data on specialized frames for me to reference. And unlike Plume, this new frame has no compatible data from an original source.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'We will be facing many complications even when we are just trying to get someone to adapt to it.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The research has already hit a bottleneck. If we want to move on to the next stage...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I need an exceptional Construct with M.I.N.D. stability way above average.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I need to find someone who matches the criteria and is willing to volunteer.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "I'll leave it to you, then.", 4: '1'}
